channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The actor said writers should create roles “just as good as James Bond, but for a woman”.
item.title: Daniel Craig says women shouldn’t need to play James Bond

item.description: The pandemic’s US death toll now matches the 675,000 toll of 1919 Spanish flu - and another 100,000 or so Americans are estimated to die of COVID-19 this year.
item.title: COVID will be the biggest killer in US history by end of the year

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: “It would be naive to think a decision of this nature was not going to cause disappointment, obviously, to the French,” Morrison said, ahead of talks at the UN summit.
item.title: Morrison lands in NYC for talks, says he expected French subs anger

item.dc:creator: Kate Rose
item.description: “Absolutely outrageous” protests were not carried out by union members, according to John Setka, while Labor’s Bill Shorten condemned the “hard-right man-baby Nazis”.
item.title: ‘Absolutely outrageous’ protesters weren’t union, says Setka

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The Australian share market is set to fall 1.4 per cent this morning following falls in US stocks.
item.title: ASX to open lower following Wall St drop

item.description: The ECB highlighted “the mental and physical well-being of our players and support staff” rather than security in joining New Zealand by abandoning a Pakistan tour.
item.title: ‘Failing their fraternity’: PCB angry as England shelve Pakistan tour

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Panthers officials say Viliame Kikau, Dylan Edwards and Api Koroisau are going nowhere, and have praised Ivan Cleary for reaching another preliminary final.
item.title: Panthers confident they can keep star trio ... and coach Ciraldo

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, September 21

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Three people have been charged in relation to the 2020 Eastern Freeway truck crash in which four police officers died.
item.title: New charges laid over Eastern Freeway crash

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Voters turning away from the Coalition are looking to minor parties, including Clive Palmer’s United Australia Party, new political research shows.
item.title: Morrison holds lead but Albanese narrows the gap as preferred prime minister

item.description: “Many users are calling to see if they can travel to La Palma or go for a weekend to see the volcano as close up as possible,” the ferry operator said.
item.title: Come enjoy volcano ‘show’, minister urges tourists as lava destroys homes

item.description: Everything you need to know to find a winner at the Central Coast meeting.
item.title: Race-by-race preview and tips for Wyong on Tuesday

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: The Victorian construction industry will be shut down after a violent protest, the NSW government plans to pour billions of dollars into LGAs of concern and it’s the first day of the PM’s visit to the US.
item.title: Australia news LIVE: COVID-19 cases continue to grow across the nation as states and territories look for lockdown exit strategies

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Just days following his two tries against South Africa, Len Ikitau has recommitted to Australian rugby.
item.title: After springing to attention against Boks, Wallabies star locked in until 2023

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: “The world will see, and your people will remember and history will judge.”
item.title: Boris Johnson rebukes world leaders on climate change and warns history will judge them

item.description: Pets lower the levels of cortisol, the “stress hormone”, and provide relief of depression, anxiety and social isolation. Some neurotransmitters have also been studied.
item.title: How your pet changes your brain chemistry for the better

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: We need to consider what are we giving up by letting home values inflate so high.
item.title: No bubbles in sight, but Australia’s property boom comes at a cost

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: An artist suing the Australia Council claims their project was defunded because of the feared reprisal.
item.title: Australia Council denies it said Prime Minister wouldn’t like artist’s self-insemination project

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: The AUKUS partners have managed to alienate France in the process of assembling their new coalition.
item.title: As the world reorders itself to resist China, it’s a pity the latest move was so boofheaded

item.description: Bill Gates has raised more than $US1 billion in corporate funding for Breakthrough Energy Catalyst from BlackRock’s Larry Fink and Microsoft’s Satya Nadella to rally support for some of the world’s most demanding clean-energy projects.
item.title: Bill Gates raises $US1b as corporate CEOs join race to drive clean tech

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Christian Porter being back in the news reminded CBD of some extracts from “Briefs” - the magazine from the law students of UWA.
item.title: ‘Dear Dr Chilla’: Resurfacing Christian Porter’s undergraduate humour

item.dc:creator: Michael Evans
item.description: Australian drug syndicate alleged to have network from South Africa to Spain and Albania to import tonnes of illicit drugs.
item.title: Fake UK passport, Albanian fraudster, dead German bikie: Australian drug ring’s network

item.dc:creator: Annika Smethurst
item.description: The desire of NSW health officials to focus on the effect of the vaccine rollout could explain why its plan to ease restrictions differs from Victoria’s road map.
item.title: How NSW and Victoria arrived at two different road maps

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The Premier has stressed the plan for hospitals to survive the coming months depended on the system being “technically overwhelmed in some ways”.
item.title: Dispute over COVID ward staffing as hospitals brace for worst month

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: The prediction came as Premier Daniel Andrews walked back a pledge to establish 4000 extra ICU beds in the state.
item.title: Feared case surge in Victorian hospitals would demand ICU overhaul

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Liberal MPs want the federal government to set more ambitious climate targets for 2030 ahead of a climate summit in November.
item.title: ‘Higher ambition’: Moderate Liberals urge government to raise climate targets

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Those looking to upgrade may find themselves paying for a lot more data than they really need.
item.title: Apple iPhone 13 plans aimed at the data hungry

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Mask-wearing will remain indefinitely in some settings as experts predict strict lockdowns will not protect COVID-free parts of the country from the pandemic forever.
item.title: COVID-19 will remain a ‘fire’ fought on multiple fronts, Doherty Institute says

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: South Sydney have lost three preliminary finals in a row. But one of Australia’s leading sports psychologists has explained why the curse can be broken.
item.title: Wayne Bennett’s Dr Phil adamant Rabbitohs’ hoodoo can be broken

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Like many community sporting clubs across NSW, the Kellyville Ridge Cricket Club is in a state of suspended animation. Nobody can tell them when the season can start, or what it will look like when it does, and the costs are piling up.
item.title: ‘Building blocks of society’: Fears for COVID-crippled community sports clubs

item.dc:creator: Janine Perrett
item.description: It will now be left to the poor voters in his WA seat of Pearce to determine just how immune the electorate has become to the litany of scandals, conflicts and contempt.
item.title: Porter shows the bar is now so low for Parliamentary accountability it’s getting hard to see

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Victoria, NSW and ACT to roar back to economic life when their lockdowns end, but stay isolated from the rest of the nation.
item.title: Divided states tipped to roar back to economic life in time for Christmas

item.dc:creator: Anne Hyland
item.description: After a successful decade of more women joining Australia’s biggest company boards, the push is now on for greater gender parity in senior management ranks.
item.title: Gender parity targets ‘need teeth’, says Smith-Gander

item.description: A student opened fire at a university in Russia, leaving six people dead and 28 hurt, before being shot by police and detained, officials said.
item.title: Several killed in Russian university shooting

item.description: President Joe Biden will ease foreign travel restrictions to the US beginning in November, allowing foreigners into the country if they have proof of vaccination and a negative COVID-19 test.
item.title: US to require international travellers to be vaccinated against COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The scenario paints a bleak picture for rural areas with lower than average vaccination rates, and could lead to some towns being shut off from the rest of the state.
item.title: COVID would reach WA’s regions within weeks of outbreak, modelling shows

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Many artists have been unable to present work created for cancelled exhibitions and festivals: the Melbourne Art Fair will be a chance to show it off.
item.title: Melbourne’s art fair set to return with huge February show

item.description: Christian Porter’s resignation from the ministry should not be an end to the “blind trust” matter. The public should be told who has bankrolled his legal fees.
item.title: Porter’s secretive behaviour should disqualify him from Parliament

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today’s interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and Superquiz, Tuesday, September 21

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: Gai Waterhouse left the Supreme Court yesterday with renewed hope of obtaining her training licence.
item.title: In the Herald: September 21, 1991

item.dc:creator: Thomas Keneally
item.description: Forty years ago, we finally had a dictionary to call our own. But the Macquarie was more than a collection of Australian slang, as Thomas Keneally found out.
item.title: From the Archives, 1981: A dictionary by Australians, for Australians

item.description: Sitting there staring out at a virus-riddled city, the entire quarantine machine seemed like a massive waste of time, manpower and resources.
item.title: Now is the time to trial home quarantine for returned travellers

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Fast-growing Australian payments startup Airwallex has secured a fresh round of funding, valuing it at $US4 billion ($5.5 billion) on paper.
item.title: ‘Wave of global unicorns’: Airwallex hits $5.5 billion valuation

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 21, 2021

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 20, 2021

item.description: Queen Elizabeth’s granddaughter has given birth to a baby girl, her first child with husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, Buckingham Palace announced on Monday.
item.title: Princess Beatrice, Queen Elizabeth’s granddaughter, gives birth to baby girl

item.description: The outcome of the months-long trial of Paul Rusesabagina will be a surprise to few.
item.title: Man who inspired ‘Hotel Rwanda’ film found guilty of terrorism-related charges

item.description: Pfizer says its COVID-19 vaccine works for younger children and that it will seek US approval soon – a key step toward beginning vaccinations for those currently ineligible.
item.title: Pfizer says COVID-19 vaccine works in kids aged 5 to 11
